From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Thu Mar 16 18:16:20 1995
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) id SAA07577; Thu, 16 Mar 1995 18:16:20 -0800
Received: from netcom19.netcom.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) with ESMTP id SAA07564; Thu, 16 Mar 1995 18:16:16 -0800
Received: from DialupEudora by netcom19.netcom.com (8.6.10/Netcom)
	id SAA21190; Thu, 16 Mar 1995 18:13:44 -0800
Message-Id: <199503170213.SAA21190@netcom19.netcom.com>
X-Sender: jsl@localhost
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Date: Thu, 16 Mar 1995 18:24:00 -0800
To: crunch@netcom.com (John Draper)
From: jsl@netcom.com (John S. Lee)
Subject: S O S from Australia
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

>All around me,   I was pumping in energy into the dance crowd,  and to
>be honest,   they just aren't used to seeing a old 52 yr old dude from
>America dancing like a maniac.    It seems that the club scene here has
>a really interesting vibe.   One thing I noticed missing are the Gangsta
>types.   They just don't exist here.   Or if they do,   they are doing
>a good job of hiding.   Very few Black people here.

Hello everyone, long time no talk to much less see.  I really just wanted
to continue lurking, but I knew that eventually all it would take to bring
me out was something like the above.  Considering the political climate and
the anti-non-white sentiments rampant in this country at this time, I have
no other recourse than to fight.  Especially against stupid remarks, no
matter how innocent, like the one above.

I don't really think Crunch understood the implications of his words.
Crunch has never shown ME any sign of predjudice, although I know he has
some like we all do.  But this insistence on the code word gangster,
gangsta, etc. is very tiring.  And quite suprising considering the realtive
high IQ's of the folx here on the list.

Listen up, the word is a code word for anybody who looks like me (African
American), or people who have a relatively high melanin content as compared
to the average European (read Latino/Hispanic).  It is not used to describe
gangs of Whites, or people of European ancestry.  That's how it is.  You
may decide to use this word, and if so, you should expect that unless you
start naming particular gang names, that I, and others, may take offense to
it.  Use your words as you choose, but consider WHO you're really talking
about.  And be prepared for the consequences of your actions.

There has been much discussion about "gansta types" by defining those
qualities of dress that TV has pumped into some peoples head.  This has
been the way people have skated around the real meaning of the code word.
Fact is people use it to describe people of color exclusively.  You may not
mean it in such a fashion, but that is how it's currently used.  Today I am
dressed in baggies, a xxlarge sweatshirt, and Dickies (the ORIGINAL "gang"
shoe).  To most, I would be dressed like a "gangsta".  My income, values,
and current job, dictate that I am as yuppie as you can get.  Yet the only
thing people will see as I walk across the street is that I am dressed like
a "gangsta", and I am black.  I spend half of my life fighting these
predjudices, and the other half in fear of persecution by those who throw
around labels so easily.  This sucks...unless you are a minority, you would
not immediately understand.  But I digress...

I am sick and tired of black/latino being associated with violence and
general mayhem.  It's the same shit many of your grandparents used to
beleive about blacks and other minorities just two generations ago.  I see
the vestiges of racism are still strong, and vibrant, even in "our" scene.
Truly sickening...

Look Crunch & others who insist on using this stoopid word without any
backup as to what you're talking about.  You ain't met no fucking REAL
gangstah's.  They ain't got time to go to raves, and hunt you out.  You
ain't got nothing for them, much less them for you.  If you did run across
a few gangstah's consider yourself lucky to be alive, and that you were not
part of some ridiculous initiation ritual.  I doubt you'd be alive to talk
about it.  You ain't seen no gangstah at no raves.  You've seen some youths
who got bored, like many do, and decided to take their boredom out on
you/your event, whatever.  This will continue to happen as the youth of
this country are cut out from even the basic liberties of free assembly.
But rest assured, if they were gangs, many would not be alive to talk about
it.  So please give this bullshit a rest.

As for the "vibe" of Australia...maybe you should spend some time amongst
the ORIGINAL peoples who are shut out from their system Crunch.  Maybe you
oughta read some history about the places you visit Crunch.  Just as
Amerikkka engaged in genocide so that you could have a Full Moon party
without the natives getting restless, that Great Rock in the Pacific was
invavded by the dregs of England, and subsequently settled through equally
genocidal methods.  There is little doubt why they call Australia
Amerikkka's "Sister Nation/Country".  The correlation you draw about
gangstas and blacks is equally disturbing.  Especially since the most
deadly gang is the cops, the Congress, and of course our President. You're
52, and the signs that you have not outgrown your generations prejudices
are obvious.  I take complete offense at your characterizations of blacks
as gangstah's and demand a public apology for your outrageous statements.
I would also hope you learn something about the country you're visiting
other than partying with the opressors.

Rinse your brain....

Peace out,
John

=======
Since I started talking:  I hope all goes well for F&F this weekend.
Congrats on the anniversary of your event! May you guys and your Friends &
Family have many many more!!!!

Peace out one more time! :)


                "Prejudice is the reason of fools." - Voltaire
              jsl@netcom.com - public key available upon request

EXCUSE ME?  what exactly are you saying here?  are you implying that 
unless someone jumps in "to the rescue" i will think they're an ass?  i 
understand that there are times when people can and cannot intervene, but 
if one cannot intervene one goes to get someone to help.  one does NOT 
continue "partying."  

anyway, i'm not saying that anyone should feel "guilty."  guilt 
accomplishes nothing.  you learn from your mistakes, if any were made, 
and go on.  what's important AFTER an attack is to help the survivor, 
warn others and hold those responsible accountable.  and if you're doing 
security at a party, one of your responsibilities is to keep the space 
safe, which means intervention, whether it's yourself and others or 
calling the cops if need be, tho' i hate to say it.  

in love and @,
monicat

On Thu, 16 Mar 1995, John S. Lee wrote:

> Listen up, the word is a code word for anybody who looks like me (African
> American), or people who have a relatively high melanin content as compared
> to the average European (read Latino/Hispanic).  It is not used to describe
> gangs of Whites, or people of European ancestry.  That's how it is.  You

I beg to differ - up here in Vancouver, myself and my friends use the 
word "gansta" to describe ANYONE, regardless of race or color, who acts 
or dresses in the manner commonly associated (in this area) with real 
gangster behavior.  Of course, having no real gangs here like they do in 
LA and other big cities, our perception of gangsters is created by movies 
and television.  I personally have referred to whites as "gangstas", and 
will continue to do so, as it's a word that seems appropriate and one 
which these "gangstas" refer to themselves as.  I know when I say it, 
there are no racial connotations implied...

> Fact is people use it to describe people of color exclusively.  You may not
> mean it in such a fashion, but that is how it's currently used.  Today I am

That's how it's currently used by SOME people, not all.  

> Look Crunch & others who insist on using this stoopid word without any
> backup as to what you're talking about.  You ain't met no fucking REAL
> gangstah's.  They ain't got time to go to raves, and hunt you out.  You
> ain't got nothing for them, much less them for you.  If you did run across
> a few gangstah's consider yourself lucky to be alive, and that you were not
> part of some ridiculous initiation ritual.  I doubt you'd be alive to talk
> about it.  You ain't seen no gangstah at no raves.  You've seen some youths
> who got bored, like many do, and decided to take their boredom out on
> you/your event, whatever.  This will continue to happen as the youth of
> this country are cut out from even the basic liberties of free assembly.
> But rest assured, if they were gangs, many would not be alive to talk about
> it.  So please give this bullshit a rest.

Just a little bit harsh, don't you think?  I'm sure Crunch and others 
don't claim to have met any REAL gangstahs...the fact is, some people try 
very hard to cultivate this image, and wear the label of "gangsta" with 
pride, even if they have no clue either as to what REAL gangstahs are 
like.  Being a minority member myself, I understand your anger, but in 
this case I think it's a little misdirected.

> Amerikkka engaged in genocide so that you could have a Full Moon party
> without the natives getting restless, that Great Rock in the Pacific was

Genocide: the systematic extermination or destruction of an entire people 
or national group.
The very fact that American natives are around to fight for their rights 
today indicates to me that genocide wasn't carried out.  Yes, the 
treatment they've recieved has been abysmal, but I think genocide goes a 
bit too far...

> gangstas and blacks is equally disturbing.  Especially since the most
> deadly gang is the cops, the Congress, and of course our President. You're

Oh please!  Now, like many others on this list, I have problems with 
police now and then, but I'm still pretty fucking happy that they're 
around.  

Jim

 On Thu, 16 Mar 1995, Jim Trickett e wrote
>
>> Amerikkka engaged in genocide so that you could have a Full Moon party
>> without the natives getting restless, that Great Rock in the Pacific was
>
>Genocide: the systematic extermination or destruction of an entire people
>or national group.
>The very fact that American natives are around to fight for their rights
>today indicates to me that genocide wasn't carried out.  Yes, the
>treatment they've recieved has been abysmal, but I think genocide goes a
>bit too far...


If genocide isn't the right word than I don't know what word you would use
to describe what happened to the Native American people.  What word would
use to describe the death of the 10 million people who lived here before we
did.  It wasn't a complete extermination of every Native American but it
was an extermination of Native American culture and ideals.  The US did
more than treat Native Americans abysmally, they took their land away, took
their children and put them in boarding schools, and they took their
culture away.  Today Native American reservations are among the poorest
areas in the US.  You must come to terms with the fact that the United
States was built on the graves and backs of the people who lived here
before.  We broke  every treaty we signed whenever it was suitable to us,
we must understand what happened, otherwise as the ol' cliche goes "those
that do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it".  Please read up on
your history, it is importent, real peoples were killed, and real people
are living in complete poverty due to our racist culture.

LOVE,
gabe

Ah, yes, as a part-time punk I can tell you that there's a lot of punk/rave
cross over.  Even lots of straight-edge punx in the rave scene (I was one once).
Queers should note that there are 3 different queer-punk events going on
Friday alone - including Green Day faves Pansy Division at 924 Gilman.
I heard that local punk gods Rancid may incorporate a jungle influence on
their next recording.  Not surprising to me - it's not a huge leap from ska
to jungle.

Quick note to SF people:  See ya at F&F!  Let me know what you think of my
new Netscape 1.1-enhanced page!  See below for URL.

Wow, lots of out-of-towners on the list these days!  Welcome.

Not much hardcore in these here parts west of the Sierra.  The house and
trance scenes are tops, though.

You can also subscribe to mailing lists serving the Midwest (mw-raves) and
the UK (uk-dance).  Gopher hyperreal.com for details.

To get Uk-dance, send a message to listserv@tqmcomms.co.uk with the word
s*bscribe the first word in the body, substituting a u for the *.

I'll be in the UK for Tribal Gathering, but I realize it's a long way from
Newcastle.

(more below)

Sorry, no one can do that for you (although you *can* get help).

Basically, you have to experience and root out your mental conditioning.

And, I've yet to see any solid philosophical foundation for the zippie thing...

Ken

-- Forwarded message follows --

From: wisdomkeep@aol.com (Wisdomkeep)
Subject: Global Solar Ceremonies 3/21/95
Date: 28 Feb 1995 15:23:19 -0500

Please copy, pass on, or otherwise network this information

   SOLAR CEREMONIES SET FOR MARCH 21, 1995 
 ELDERS CALL FOR WORLDWIDE CONVERGENCE OF SPIRITUAL INTENT

 Please consider this message as a call for human beings to unite in
spiritual intent for peace, unity, and awakening.   March 21, 1995 is a
critical opportunity to strive through prayer and ceremony to bridge the
gaps between the continents, religions, cultures, and races for all ages. 

   The moment of Sunrise on March 21, 1995  marks an important opportunity
for prayer and ceremony according to the Mayan people of the Yucatan
Peninsula, Mexico -- as with the event called Harmonic Convergence on
August 16, 1987, which was also identified via their calendars.   Mayan
Daykeepers and traditional elders say their sacred texts and calendars
identify March 21 as especially important for respectful attention from
human beings in the Americas and around the world.  They have asked that
all who feel called to do so take a stand for unity on this date, and
strive to awaken to fulfill their sacred destiny: "to stand in peace as
true sons and daughters of the Cosmic Light."  It is time, Traditional
Maya Elders say, to live out our true solar destinies in good relation
with the whole circle of life. 

   By the use of their ancient calendar cycles -- widely recognized as
more sophisticated and accurate than the Gregorian calendars now used by
the Western world -- the Maya appreciate that the 1995 Vernal Equinox, and
the Sunrise following it, are the completion of a teaching that they have
held and passed on for many generations.  The moment of Sunrise marks the
end of two cycles of Kal'Tun (two cycles of 260 years), and initiates a
time when ancient and hidden knowledge is to be reawakened. The Maya say
they understand it as the end of the "age of belief" and the start of 
"the age of knowledge."  Don Hunbatz Men, Mayan teacher and Daykeeper,
emphasizes that this information is for everyone, not just the Maya.

The Path of the Sun and Mayan Prophecy

 Watching from the Earth,  the Sun travels 182 days to the North and
returns 182 days to the South again every  year.  This is the cycle of the
Solstices. The midpoint of this cycle is another cycle of East and West
called the Equinoxes. On the Equinoxes, the Sun crosses a center point and
makes an exact 90-degree angle directly over the Pyramid of  Ku'Kulkan 
(El Castillo)  at the sacred site of Chichen Itza on Mexico's Yucatan
peninsula -- a place that some say represents the turtle's head on the
continent known for millennia as Turtle Island (North America).  The
relationship of the Sun to the Earth at this sensitive point creates the
world-famous phenomenon of a dramatic shadow of 7 triangles.  The
triangles of solar light and shadow  represent the potential awakening of
7 centers of the human body --  the wheels of subtle spiritual light that,
in the Orient,  are called Chakras.   This natural event happens every
Vernal and Autumnal Equinox, but it is in the Spring of 1995 that the
reawakening of the cosmic human may  be activated. This is indicated in
the paraphrased Mayan prophecy below, as given by Hunbatz Men.

 In the year 1475, before the arrival of the Spanish, The Supreme Maya
Council revealed the long-held vision of an ancient Solar Grandmother
named X'Nuuk'K'in  that a calendar cycle of twice the Kal'Tun of 260 years
had to go by in order for the Solar Culture to flourish again for the
benefit of all humanity.  In the spring of 1995, this 520-year period will
be completed. Thus, 1995 is a decisive year, the prophecy advises, and the
human race will have to enter the path of cosmic light if it is to remain
a thinking species.  Humans will have to seek the path of initiation on
Earth and in Heaven. "Through Solar Initiation human beings will be able
to see the luminosity of the Great Spirit...through Solar Initiation, the
sleeping body of humankind can be awakened... Hunab K'u (Creator) will
flash like lightning that will pierce the shadows that envelop the human
race. Let us prepare to receive the light of knowledge."

 Many traditional elders among the Maya understand this event as an
opportunity for initiation into a luminous consciousness -- the awakening
of  humanity into an Age of Knowledge (Itza Age).  Via the magnetic grid
of energy that envelops planet Earth, and the many sensitive spots on the
Earth often referred to as Sacred Sites, the elders say the solar
ceremonies in Chichen Itza will anchor a unifying intent to activate
humanity.  This intention can be strengthened and magnified by people who
come together elsewhere around the world in prayer and ceremony, at sacred
sites as well as in their backyards and public gathering places.  This, it
is said,  will initiate a potent healing process for all.

  Traditional Maya spiritual elders will make prayers for peace, unity,
and awakening on March 21, in fellowship with a group of Tibetan Lamas and
also with pilgrims of all nations and faiths.   Sisters and Brothers who
are unable join in physical form may join in Spirit.  A Council of 
traditional Mayan Elders has asked people of good heart--no matter their
race or their spiritual tradition--to join in prayer  at the Vernal
Equinox, and at Sunrise, local time, on the morning of March 21, 1995.  We
are asked to unite   with the understanding that we are all connected, and
all live in the same house: the house of Mother Earth. We all breathe the
same air, and drink the same water.  We must live in honor and respect. 
They ask all to pray -- in whatever tradition calls their hearts and minds
 -- for peace, unity, and awakening.

 Letters of prayer and good intention may be sent to: The Center for Mayan
Studies APDO 7-014 Merida, 7 Yucatan, Mexico. These letters will be
anchored in a sacred site during this ceremony.

A Solar Meditation You May Wish to Try

 Prayers and good intentions from all traditions are welcomed to help
create a unified field of spiritual intention on March 21.  If you wish,
you are welcome to perform the simple ceremony outlined below, as given by
spiritual elders among the Maya.

 In their tradition, the Maya had and have an intimate relationship with
the Sun. They understand that the information/energy we require to live
comes from the Creator through the Sun.  They further understand that the
Sun can help to heal our physical and emotional illnesses. In these times
when humanity receives so much information and energy from sources other
than the Sun, the elders say, we must begin to remember how to work again
with the Sun.   Everyone is encouraged to initiate solar meditations and
related events at Sacred Sites or in the areas where they live at Sunrise
- March 21, 1995. Below is a ceremony you can perform in unity with others
from around the world at that time.

 Face the rising Sun and begin to meditate. With respect, ask the Creator
in your own way (Hunab K'u, or "One Giver of Movement and Measure" in the
language of the Maya who hold the knowledge of  Chichen Itza) for
permission to reenter cosmic memory. Ask to be reawakened to the ancient
knowledge of the cosmos. As the Sun begins to rise look directly at it. 
Please use discretion here:  just one second of pure sunlight directly in
the eyes is enough, more can be harmful.  Then close your eyes and begin
to say the name of the SUN in your language, or in the Mayan language
(K'IN).  Catch your Spirit by holding your hands out in front of your face
as if you were holding a sphere.  As Om-m-m-m  is a name of the Universe,
K'IN is a name of the SUN.  It sounds like, "K'ieeeeeennn" with a distinct
'E' sound.  You may need to practice this. When you do it properly you
will hear the sound of the Sun in your ears and in your head.

  Say K'IN  7 times into your hands for your body,  7 times for your
spirit, and 7 times for the healing and awakening of the Earth and
humanity. You will feel the energy in your hands, and hear the sound of
the SUN in your heart.  Now offer the blessings of your Spirit on the
Earth by bending down and placing your palms flat upon the Earth. Allow
your Spirit to enter the Earth and send your blessings and intentions to
walk on Earth in a sacred manner that will awaken yourself and others into
right living once again.  So Traditional Elders among the Maya have asked.



  - - With acknowledgment and appreciation for the writings of Aluna Joy
YaxK'in, whose article was adapted for this posting, and also for Hunbatz
Men and other Mayan Daykeepers who consulted on this message and the
timing of its delivery --
 
-- End forwarded message --

---------------------------------------------------------------
>LIVING BOOKS
>
>JOB ANNOUNCEMENT
>
>Living Books is recognized as the leading creator of interactive stories 
>for children on CD-ROM.  Our  award-winning titles contain vocal tunes 
>and upbeat songs which accompany dance animations.  Due to our rapid 
>expansion, we are currently hiring a Sound Designer II in our Sound 
>Department.
>
>Position Summary:
>
>The Sound Designer  II will work with software designers and senior sound 
>staff to create music and sounds for our products.  In addition to 
>achieving the highest possible audio production values, the Sound 
>Designer II will be responsible for adhering to the stylistic approach 
>established for the product.
>
>Sample Responsibilities:
>
>1.	Create and edit sound effects and synchronize with 			
>animations and other  software features.
>2.	Compose music to support diverse moods and environments.
>3.	Arrange music for a variety of synthesizers including 		
>General MIDI synthesizers.
>4.	Record and edit dialogue.
>5.	Review implementation of sounds and music in software.
>6.	Maintain accurate records of sound files for archival.
>		
>Qualifications and skills required:
>
>1. 	Four year degree or equivalent in music performance or 		
>composition, audio production or 	electronic music.
>2.	Two years experience as a recording studio engineer, live 		
>sound engineer, or broadcast engineer.  	A strong 			
>understanding of the physical properties of sound and 		acoustics.
>3.	Ability to compose music in a broad range of styles.  Strong 	
>understanding of music theory equivalent to a four 			
>year music program.
>4.	Experience arranging music for synthesizers, including 		
>extensive synthesizer patch editing and 	use of sequencing 	
>software, such as Studio Vision or Performer.  Knowledge of 	various 
>synthesis techniques.
>5. 	Familiarity with  digital sound editing tools such as Sound 	
>Designer and Alchemy, and a strong 	understanding of digital 	audio.
>6.	Intermediate to advanced level of performance on a musical 		
>instrument helpful.
>7. 	Experience with Macintosh.
>	
>To apply, please send resume (with salary history) and a cassette of six 
>original songs, four of which are between 10-20 seconds long (with intro, 
>melody and outro, not vamps only) and two of which are 1.25-2.5 minutes 
>long.  Songs should reflect various genres of music and include at least 
>one vocal tune.
>Please mail cassette and resume with salary history to:
>
>	Living Books
>	500 Redwood Boulevard
>	Novato, CA 94948
>	Attention: Robyn Berry
>
>				(No phone calls, please.)
>
>We  will be moving to San Francisco in May, 1995
>Living Books is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We all make mistakes:
>so, the moral of the story is: don't take funny punch at parties, even if 
>you know the person serving it, unless you are sure of how much of 
>whatever is in it;  do not take yohimbe unless you have researched it, 
>and never serve yohimbe at parties.  philip infinity (the promoter of 8th 
>House) was totally irresponsible to have served it without any warning or 
>instructions, and he will be called on it.  

I have to step in. yes, funny punch is a problem, you should ask first.
yes, MAOIs are bad news if used wrong, but acid is safe with them,
phsiologically, see, acid, shrooms and dmt do fine with MAOIs. Yer friend
just couldn't handle the stronger trip created thru the yohimbe.

Yohimbe ALONE is great, if you avoid those foods. Take 250mg vit.C 1/2
before, and anothe 250 with it(prevents puking and makes it smoother), and
you will either dance and feel great or toss in bed and do the humpty
horiz-dance forever. I reccommend it, but only after someone has read the
warnings in psychedelic shamanism. I feel the cloud 9 people are too lax on
warnin when they sell it, and yes, people should not distribut it at
parties on that massive a scale. Someone might lie and take E or speed and
find their lungs full of fluid and their body full of death. And Geraldo
will be able to do another special on us.

When I handed out Rue at F&F, it was only a pinch, not enuf to have a MAoI
effect, just enuf to make teeth floresce in the blacklight, and only I
myslef took enuf of it alone to experience its pure effect. If someone
wants to mess around with an MAOI, the should bring it themselves.  If one
gives it out, like at the party you mentioned, shit will happen.

INFORMED consent was lacking, i guess. Glad you helped yer friend out, that
really shows how much you care for them. Hope if I ever lose it, that I
will have good friends around, and won't hurt anyone either physically or
emotionally.  But about F&F, why don't you work the door with me, I'll sign
yer cast! You could do the Ski Diva thing.....:)

I dunno, since Maui is gone from SFR, I'll have to defend the white stuff.
Look, doesn't it seem like a little too much media hype over drugs again?
Our life-styles of a disposable society creates more individual pollution
than any meth lab. Our detergents, our soaps, our huge wasting of water,
all that plastic and cardboard and glass that our food comes in, we are
poisoning our world and now we point our finger at meth labs???

So pot smoking leads to carpet spraying of ozark forests and coke to
massive deforestation in Columbia, thru our government's war on drugs.
Eating processed or chain-food burgers leads to amazon forest being
replaced by quick-fix cattle ranchers, chicken to massive animal abuse,
milk to erosion due to soy plantations in the third world to supply dairy
feed, jeans to exploitation of immigrant women, stereos and shoes to sweat
shops in Taiwan, and now the internet is the vehicle of kiddie-porn and
bestiality, so let's log off.

Prolly most things are more complex than some reporter without a clue and
deadline to meet.

But I could be wrong:)

From: jocelyn@hal.com (Jocelyn Cordell)

Subject: history (LONG)

Precedence: bulk

About genocide and (farther down) raves:

My full name is Jocelyn Ward Cordell. Ward is a family name,
derived from Mary Jane Ward, the english name of the 
daughter of White Cloud, former chief of the Creek tribe 
of northwestern Florida/southeastern Alabama. 

When General Jackson moved his Union troops southward through 
this area to preserve the union, he/the union delivered an ultimatum 
to the Creek tribe to leave their land. As an agricultural 
tribe, they asked to be allowed to remain on their land until 
their crops could be harvested. Their refusal to immediately comply 
was termed "hostile" and they were killed. There are no full-blooded 
Creek left. There is, however, an honorary statue of General Jackson
in the heart of the Vieux Carre in New Orleans. 

My mother told me about my history first when I was fairly 
young (about 8). when I asked her to recount it later (about 13),
she denied it and denied having ever told me about it. Then 
when i was 17, she suggested I apply to colleges as a Native 
American (i didn't). Who can I ask about my history now?

What happens if we see genocide as a socio-psychological event 
instead of a physical one?

Despite the fact that the government labels my mother as a 
"legal minority", she locked the car doors when we passed 
"minorities" on the street- we had many car-bound, 
power-lock wars. And I still love her. I finally asked her 
if it was the Lopez's (good family friends) or Jackie (a black long time
friend & co-worker) we were passing, would she still lock them out? 
I then asked her to lock the doors in the garage as soon as 
she gets in the car, and she does. And I still love her.

This, to me, is where raving can (does?) help race relations. 
The love is strong enough that we can choose to inform and educate 
someone about her/his hateful habits, rather than ostracizing or 
alienating that person. The other power of rave, like racism, 
is that it is an international meme.  

To that end:
I highly recommended finding and reading some Frederic Frantz essays.
Frantz was a psychiatrist in Africa who studied (in an attempt to heal) 
and wrote about the psycological effects of colonization on African 
natives. Also, check out some essays by Ngugi wa Thiongo who addresses 
the colonizing of the mind. For those of you who prefer fiction, try:
any novel by Ngugi(Kenyan, Gikuyu) or Chinua Achebe (Nigerian, Ibo tribe)
IMHO, Ngugi is one of the only modern revolutionary writers. Start with 
Devil on the Cross.

When Rain Clouds Gather by Bessie Head (Rhodesian)

The River Between (can't remember the author)

Waiting for the Barbarians by Coetze (Dutch? writer in Africa)

In the Castle of My Skin (can't remember author, but it's about 
the West Indies)

The Grass is Singing (can't remember, female African author)

any novel by Nadine Gordimer (South African Communist)

State of War by Ninotchka Rosca (Phillipino, my second all time favorite)

First all-time favorite: The Beautyful Ones are Not Yet Born by 
Ayah Kwei Armah(Nigerian?)

Exile and the Kingdom by Camus

Ain't I a Woman by bell hooks

Biographical, written as fiction: try Down Second Avenue by 
Ezekiel Mphalele (autobiography about living in an Aparteid ghetto in SA)

plays: 

anything by Wole Soyinka (traditional Ibo tragedies)
The Tempest by W. Shakespeare

Take care-

Jocelyn

On Thu, 16 Mar 1995, D. M. Ilstrup wrote:

> >treatment they've recieved has been abysmal, but I think genocide goes a 
> >bit too far...
> 
> Yeah, and there are still Jews in Europe, so I guess Hitler was a nice guy.
> OK, that's harsh, but be real, we're living in a world that has more than
> its fair share of assholes. You don't think distributing blankets infected
> with smallpox or forcing entire tribes of people on thousand mile marches
> with hardly any food or water was genocide? Maybe I misunderstood you.

I was just being picky with wording, that's all.  It's just that 
throughout history, conquering races by and large HAVE taken it upon 
themselves to completely exterminate the conquered.  Thankfully, this 
didn't happen to North American natives (or Jews, since it was brought 
up), and...call me too optimistic, but I believe that eventually natives 
will get, if not what they are due, at least some form of reparation.  
I'm not downplaying what they've gone through (or didn't have that 
intention, anyway), I was merely pointing out a case of hyperbole being 
used to try to make a point...

Jim

On Thu, 16 Mar 1995, Gabe wrote:

> did.  It wasn't a complete extermination of every Native American but it
> was an extermination of Native American culture and ideals.  The US did

It was not.  If it was a complete extermination, then you and I would 
have no idea of even the existance of native North American culture, 
which we do.  I AGREE 100% with you about the treatment they have 
received - I know the situation.  I have native friends and have heard 
from them all that you mentioned - I'm just saying that the fact that I 
have these friends means that it wasn't genocide.  I guess it was just 
nitpicking by me.  I had no intention of downplaying the plight of 
natives (North American or elsewhere)...

> before.  We broke  every treaty we signed whenever it was suitable to us,
> we must understand what happened, otherwise as the ol' cliche goes "those
> that do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it".  Please read up on
> your history, it is importent, real peoples were killed, and real people
> are living in complete poverty due to our racist culture.

Once again, you may consider this a picky point, but the use of "us" and 
"our" only applies if we retain these attitudes and viewpoints, no?  Our 
forefathers, maybe, but not "us"...

Jim

Dear Sfraves;

	Something happened last night while doing a massage exchange, not 
that it's not happened before or won't happen again.

	My client went into what I call the Budda State, that state which
even while I'm working on you, your not necessalily in touch with me, the
room or space/environment around you. This state is similar to a state
induced by narcotics, but not the really the same. Because its natural,
and I think man has reached his ability to mimic endomor-in like
substances, at least for the next century. 

	This natural state of being I have experienced on the massage 
table often, it requires you the client to be able to let go. It helps if 
you have a good therapist, a lot of trust in them, and patiences with 
youself.

	Eastern religion has talked about obatining this state , and that 
if requires many life times to accomplish, but I feel it only requires a 
little while, to be able  to experience it for the short term.

	They talk about this feeling, as being a constant state of being. 
I'm just talking about feeling like this for up to an hour or soo. 
Another important diffenece, is that Eastern states are self created 
without the outside assitance of a massage therapist. This is an 
important statement about the value of the self and respecting that.

	If not an expert on these states or Eastern religion, but I know 
some of what I said hear is close to being acturate. So please don't jump 
on me, if I made a mistake. 

	This is a wonderful, non-drug feeling if you ever had the chance 
to experience it. Its not something that I can give to you at a rave, its 
ruined if you are on drugs while I'm doing it, Thsese things I do know. I 
would highly recommend for people to try to obatin this for themselves. 
It only took me a short while going to see a therapist once a week, its 
another slice of alternative reality thats more than worth the green. 

	These states are always enhanced by proper breathing, and we 
americans don't know how to breath for health. We breath so shallow, like 
we almost don't have time for it.:)

	Go to a massage professional of your choice, stay away from the 
yellow page ad's, especially in SF, you will proablly get propositioned, 
rather than get a good massage, and learn about alternated state of being, 
thanks.

	I'll be at black dog Friday, at of course Friend & Family late 
Saturday. I' almost had a indenpent therapist or two at every event this 
weekend, but due to personal emergencies they had to back out. Look for 
me and a new person Lisa, doing massage with me. Please, and this goes 
out especially to the men, respect her for who she is, a professional 
massage therapist, nothing more, and please welcome her to our scene. 
Also look for bodywork at most of the upcoming events in the future, this 
is my gift to the scene, to organize therapist and bring them to you. 

		Peace & Love From Across Cyberspace
		 aka Brian Darkness, LMT/BSEE/CET

Fraser: (and everyone else:) - only people whose addresses are listed
as being on the sfraves mailing list can post to sfraves.  This
prevents a lot of noise (like "svbscribe me" messages and spam attacks)
from being sent to the list.  "fraser@megatripolis.org" isn't listed 
as being on sfraves, I presume David Dei is forwarding mail to 
you.  However, I can make exceptions, and I do that by adding your 
name to another file here on hyperreal, so I don't have to forward these 
manually.

	Brian

> cultures, that you won't at first like nearly so much.
> 
> like, for example, and offered purely as a possible Talking P0oint for
> everyone, I'd generalise that, nevertheless, Sf goes for party (AND THERES
> NOTHING WRONG WITH THAT)  but the zippytrance evnt is more like a group
> conspiracy to apply certain scientific shamanic technologies (repetitive
> beats, synched lights, UV future strangeness etc) to bootstrap the whole
> group to the next evolutionary level.  DISCUSS.
> 
> As a general answer to some of kevins post, the zippy meme, as actually
> evolved and currently being lived by real people (many long before I ever
> verbalised the re-paradigmed lifestyle) was not and is not a quickbrew
> instant fad whipped together by me and a few mates to make a fast buck over
> the summer and then disapear.  that's how it's supposed to work over here
> and it does except that , ONCE OR TWICE in a generation's lifetime a new
> wave comes along that smashes all those habitual patterns aside.
> 
> the zippy thing started a good half dozen years ago and definitely does not
> dissipate with a few early blows, or a certain level of criticism.  by the
> time this sumer gets rolling most people will rightly remember the things
> that *were* achieved last year and can become the markers for starting this
> year, and will start to forget what *didn't happen*
> 
> and thanks, kevin, for the vote of confidence.  all I can add is this:  I
> AIN:T NO SAINT - you have been legally warned.
> 
> and, finally for now, my first apperance before you all, I must correct the
> impression kevin gives that "all the others" fucked it all up.  there were
> very honorable exceptions,  and we just were not in a numerical majority
> after I decided to make the pronia zippy tour a collective.
> 
> exceptions are ZANA, a great spirit and heart and back for now in england
> with her brood of 3 daughters.  RONNIE, who filmed the whole crazy tour
> from megatripolis london to the end of megatripolis west.  MICHAEL JOHN of
> the american rainbow family who worked with me in megalondon and on the
> tour from start to finish and through into mega west.  and KATE.  and GABE

kevin, just a quick reply to one of your points.  no, we made a very 
serious decision at the time we opened Megatripolis/London that we were 
NOT going to get involved in the usual rave binary system (do the dance 
AND the drugs)  In some ways I agree with you that it is right, but we 
decided that we were much too serious and longterm about all this to risk 
blowing the whole thing at some point.  if you keep going long enough all 
that karma comes back on you and blows up in your face.  notice I'm not 
saaying it would have been immoral or anything, just contra-indicated for 
our strategy.  OK?
and thanks again for the good things you've said about me.  people over 
here seem to think the zippies appeared last summer as a scheme for a 
fast buck.  I've never made a fast buck in my life but I've always been 
honest about saying we need BILLIONS to complete our work for the planet 
(NOW watch 'em tear into me!)
fraser

PS  Are you coming on the Chemica Sutra Expedition, Kevin?

On Sun, 12 Mar 1995, Kevin Keiper wrote:

> Okay okay; point taken about the fact that raves over here are muxh more 
> concerned with making fast buck then they are in England.  But explain 
> some thing to me.  I was envolved, for two years, with a sound system 
> that nobody had ever heard of yet we would a minum of 1500 people on a 
> week end and we were the prime catalysts in organizing the Castle MOrton 
> festival which was, with out a doubt, the biggest free rave in te 
> histotry of the planet.  It was, of course, all free some we made up from 
> it from selling sweeties: enough to be able to expand the sound system, 
> sought every one out, and have a lot of money left over for ourselves.  
> Was it not the same for Megatripolis?  Remember, your speaking to an acid 
> dealer from way back (fnaar, fnaar, fnaar!).  I hope so because that is 
> the way it should be.
> Incidently, have you not noticed the fact that their are very few 
> Scottish people over here compared to English or Londoner's?  "Every where 
> you go, always take the weather with you."(?)
> But if only you had been their, on that beautiful sunny day in a quiet 
> area of our equivilent of Golden Gate Park.  And their were people of all 
> ages, all colours, workers and dossers; beauty and love all around 
> hanging out, playing drums, talking; friends who had not seen each other 
> for a while were re-united.  ANd while their were only about 100 people 
> every knew each other realy well and for quite some time.  We were at an 
> important rest stop on our journey through life.  Us against the world, 
> the State, the grown-ups.  And at one point their was a cool breeze and 
> all noiticed it; and we were all high and felt so happy in ourselves and 
> with each other and this wind had come to relieve us in the heat.  I felt 
> like crying feeling so lucky to have friends and be around people that 
> felt the same way that I did.  And that, my friends, is, in a nutshell, 
> the Zippy vibe.  Anrt't you sad that you will never experience it?  
> ("England, oh my England.")  Ah well, at least we have Sunset (hopefully)
> And that is the main difference.  In England everybody, like Frazer and 
> Tom, is family.  All for one and one for all.  But here anybody can stab 
> you in the back at a momments notice and the result is everybody is very 
> edgey and nobody trusts eachother.  Result: people work against eachother 
> rather with each other; there are to many crossed signals.  I mean, just 
> from the time that I have subscribed to this network I have seen bitching 
> and ego trips going on that would make a bunch of new york queens 
> jeolous.  You know what I mean?  "Your so vain, you probably think this 
> song is about you!"  All the great dj's like each other, it's just these 
> bastard promoter, club owners and secruity personel that are the 
> problem.  Soloution?  Need to think about it.
> Said my poeace now.  I love Frazer, and I love the whole ethic of the 
> entire Zippy movement.  I was theiright from the start when we were 
> having raves of fifty people in houses that were condemed and everybody 
> thoiught we were mad.  I would not be the person that I am with out the 
> influence they have had, for overwheming positive good, on my whole being.
> But not I, like the Zippy's must move on and take it to te level.
> Much love and respect T.
> 
> On Sat, 11 Mar 1995, P. Greenwell wrote:
> 
> > > To: Kevin Keiper <keiper@itsa.ucsf.EDU>,
> > >         Monica and Tom <litterbx@priscilla.ultima.org>
> > > From: fraser@megatripolis.org (fraser clark)
> > > Subject: Re: Frazer, Zippies, and other things...
> > > Cc: John Draper <crunch@sysx.apana.org.au>, sfraves@hyperreal.com,
> > >         megatrip@best.com
> > > 
> > > like, for example, and offered purely as a possible Talking P0oint for
> > > everyone, I'd generalise that, nevertheless, Sf goes for party (AND THERES
> > > NOTHING WRONG WITH THAT)  but the zippytrance evnt is more like a group
> > > conspiracy to apply certain scientific shamanic technologies (repetitive
> > > beats, synched lights, UV future strangeness etc) to bootstrap the whole
> > > group to the next evolutionary level.  DISCUSS.
> > 
> > I think the idea of any one person or group saying they are attempting to 
> > "bootstrap..."  is rubbish. In order to move "a group to the next 
> > evolutionary level" you are claiming knowledge of what that level is, which
> > has a tendancy to make one sound very self-important. Any scenes "level"
> > is created by the members of it. It is not the other way around, and I for
> > one bristle at the idea that anyone claims knowledge of what particular
> > direction it should go, and that I need to be spoon-fed that direction.
> > Personally, I don't think the "scene" is, or has ever been about sex. It 
> > is about love, and/or friendship with people from a variety of different 
> > backgrounds, without regards to sex,age,color, the way you dress, etc... The 
> > truly equal opportunity "scene." If this were not the case, the "underground
> > " would have degenerated into a bunch of gangbangers looking for chicks 
> > on E to fuck, which I have seen happen to much of the "commericial" or easily
> > accessible scene.
> > > As a general answer to some of kevins post, the zippy meme, as actually
> > > evolved and currently being lived by real people (many long before I ever
> > > verbalised the re-paradigmed lifestyle) was not and is not a quickbrew
> > > instant fad whipped together by me and a few mates to make a fast buck over
> > > the summer and then disapear.  that's how it's supposed to work over here
> > > and it does except that , ONCE OR TWICE in a generation's lifetime a new
> > > wave comes along that smashes all those habitual patterns aside.
> > 
> > Again, that is your lifestyle. Live it and relish in it if it works for 
> > you. I don't think anyone has a problem with that. Do your own thing, but 
> > I don't think it appropriate for anyone to say that this is the lifestyle 
> > we should all live. I am not looking for a philosophy or the politics for 
> > my life, especially from a source of so much enjoyment. Rather be with 
> > friends and dance than learn what the proper things to do become a card 
> > carrying "zippie." 
> > 
> > > 
> > > the zippy thing started a good half dozen years ago and definitely does not
> > > dissipate with a few early blows, or a certain level of criticism.  by the
> > > time this sumer gets rolling most people will rightly remember the things
> > > that *were* achieved last year and can become the markers for starting this
> > > year, and will start to forget what *didn't happen*
> > > 
> > > and thanks, kevin, for the vote of confidence.  all I can add is this:  I
> > > AIN:T NO SAINT - you have been legally warned.
> > > 
> > > and, finally for now, my first apperance before you all, I must correct the
> > > impression kevin gives that "all the others" fucked it all up.  there were
> > > very honorable exceptions,  and we just were not in a numerical majority
> > > after I decided to make the pronia zippy tour a collective.
> > 
> > This is a prime example of the group creating the vibe, philosophy, or 
> > actions, and not the other way around. The tour was a result of who was 
> > attracted to you and or your "cause." If it didn't follow your utopian 
> > vision, then thems the breaks and welcome to the real world.
> > 
> > > 
> > > exceptions are ZANA, a great spirit and heart and back for now in england
> > > with her brood of 3 daughters.  RONNIE, who filmed the whole crazy tour
> > > from megatripolis london to the end of megatripolis west.  MICHAEL JOHN of
> > > the american rainbow family who worked with me in megalondon and on the
> > > tour from start to finish and through into mega west.  and KATE.  and GABE
> > 
> > I don't understand the necessity of raising any one person to a higher 
> > status in the group.  It sounds way too cultish, which again is not my 
> > view of the scene. And if the tour or your project flop(s)(ed) then it 
> > because not enough people share your views, or feel they need to be 
> > shown. The impression I get, at least of the San Francisco people, is that 
> > we are not together to push any one way of life. We get togther to share 
> > the company of others that love the music and know the rush of a "good 
> > vibe." Politics , lifestyles and views of "proper" rave culture aside. I, 
> > and most the people I have come into contact with already know where 
> > they're at and where there going. Thanks anyways, but I have a philosophy 
> > for living my life.
> > 
> >                                                    Peace,
> >                                                     Black Adder
> >  
> >

the zippies were not trying to be "the next big thing".  Zippy is a
cultural meme about harmonising your hemispheres (Hippy + Tecno) both
inside yourelf and on your planet. and , whatever you want to call it, 
how could anyone argue against that?
  the truth is that nearly everyone in the rave scene IS a zippy -
whatever you choose to call it.  Zippy has been going for longer than the
SF rave scene and there are more zippies in the world (UK, Europe,
Australia, New Zealand, US) than there are people living in San Francisco. 
so what?  who's competing?  why is everyone so paranoid? nobody's trying 
to conquer you, mate.  we're trying to help us all and the planet by 
making the tecno-organic balance the next dominant meme.  and don't tell 
me cultural viruses don't compete - tell the people who run the planet now.

peace, love & cooperation

fraser

The only problem I have with this thread ( and with JS Lee who started it )
is that there is usually an assumption that there are "guilty" peoples
( usually found by their skin color ) and innocent people. Specifically,
whites in this case are guilty of perpetrating genocide .....   This is 
just a bull shit restatement of blacks are guilty of... say being in gangs...
I look white but my Great grandmother was full blood cherokee. My grandfather
has spend his life on public assistance near Yuba City as an alcoholic. 
Am I white or Indian? Neither. Both. 

Now assume the Germans were guilty of genocide on the Jews. Well it might be
karmic justice.. Turning to Deuteronomy Chapter 7 ( Preacher Clay assends to
the pulpit - please laugh :-)  )...  Speaking of the seven nations of Canaan
7:2 And when the lord thy god shall deliver them before thee; thou shalt 
smite them and UTTERLY DESTROY THEM...... there are many other old verses
that indicate to me that early jews were both capable and commanded by their
god to practice genocide (attmpted genocide ) or whatever. So were they
innocent lambs brought before the germans ?  

Will we continue to blame people for the sins of their forefathers. Did 
blacks in africa never attempt genocide against other blacks?  Indians never
against indians in americas ? Is anyone truly innocent ? Or for that matter
guilty ? 

What bothers me most is that JSL starts a thread complaining that whites 
use these "code words" for blacks and people of color and then he proceeds
to PREJUDICIOUSLY condemn whites he doesn't know OR ask for what he in his
prejudice "thinks" they are saying...  based mostly on the fact that it
is a "white" that is talking...  Yes racial prejudice is alive and well but
on BOTH sides. And yes, genocide has been attempted BY many peoples of all
colors....

Now let's stop the shit slinging and turn our minds toward F&F and 
celebrating together whatever our color, size, sexual oriention or past
nationality. Let's simply be who we are together and not blame each other for
the sins of the past that ALL peoples carry not just whites....
 
More than enough said I'm sure....

Mike

Hey All,

Just remembered...

Baraka is playing at the Red Vic (on Haight) this week. 

For those who aren't familiar, Baraka is "a cinematograhpic quest to explore 
the meaning of the Sufi word Baraka, which translates roughly as 'the essence 
of life from which the evolutionary process unfolds' (or-the breath of life). 

A lot of the movie focus' on tribal/spiritual/religious cultures.

A nice prelude to Sat. nite, dontcha think?

Later...

-Jonas

nexsys:{geoffw}66-> webster genocide
geno.cide \'jen-*-.si-d\ n : the deliberate and systematic destruction of a 
   racial, political, or cultural group

The definition doesn't say anything about how successful you have to be;
to have the motive and to begin to carry it out seems to be enough.
Maybe you have to get use to the fact that the truth sometimes is shocking,
and that "evil" is almost never perpetrated by people who will acknowledge
that what they are doing is evil.  Most people in Nazi Germany didn't go 
around saying "Yeah, we are gonna kill all the Jews", alot of people started
to think that the Jews were a threat to their well being and should be
"curtailed", by the time the camps started happening people still didn't
believe that there was anything sinister going on, and while it was happening
people thought these were internment camps for dissidents, and terrorist and
that maybe a large amount of them happened to be Jews (it figures, they were
told earlier that the Jews were the source of all of their woes, I believe
it was Jewish Bankers and Communist!), remember, there was a war going on
and most governments are granted special powers during wartime.  But do you 
for one minute think the German people thought that their Government 
was committing genocide? Most didn't know or  didn't WANT to know.  
Much like the situation here in the USA, the fact of the matter is that 
the US government (we the people of the United States) carried out 
"the deliberate and systematic destruction of a racial, political, 
or cultural group" AND IS STILL AT IT!


> 
> > before.  We broke  every treaty we signed whenever it was suitable to us,
> > we must understand what happened, otherwise as the ol' cliche goes "those
> > that do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it".  Please read up on
> > your history, it is importent, real peoples were killed, and real people
> > are living in complete poverty due to our racist culture.
> 
> Once again, you may consider this a picky point, but the use of "us" and 
> "our" only applies if we retain these attitudes and viewpoints, no?  Our 
> forefathers, maybe, but not "us"...

OH yeah? what part of "us" only applies, the only people who can get off are
maybe people who are not american citizens, people it's time "we" become
responsibe for what "our" government is doing, has done, and will do to "us".
Native American, Immegrae and american-born alike.  You must realize also
that history is the story of the "ones who win".  This doen't mean you should
feel guilty about what happened, your right, you weren't around, but it is your
responsibility to seek and confront the truth and to do what ever you can to
insure that such things don't happen again.

[lots of stuff deleted]

Dear Fraser,

	I've never met you, but I've heard a lot about you.  It seems
on the surface at least that we have a lot of the same ideals and want
a lot of the same things to happen.  I've gone to a couple of your
events and found them to be interesting but not the most mind
shattering experiences that I have been exposed to (and believe me,
there HAVE been some mind shattering experiences that have taken place
here in SF).  I hear from friends that I respect that you are a "sound
bloke" and an all around good person, but there are some things that
always seem to bother me when I hear about the Zippies or other things
associated with your name.  Rather than talk a bunch of shit about how
you are, I'll just share my feelings and hope that someplace we can find
a way to communicate:

	The first thing that really bothers me is the nagging feeling that
	I get that you seem to think that you are coming here to "show us
	how to do it right".  Well there is always room for improvement and
	I'm more than willing to entertain any ideas you may have for 
	improvement but you must realize that this is the Bay Area, I myself
	live in Silicon Valley, I am old by raver standards (being  38), and
	have been a computer Hacker since I started programming assembly 
	language on an IBM 1130.  There are many "technoshamans" in the Bay
	Area, infact it could be said that the Personal Computer Revolution
	was a direct off-spring of the First Summer of Love.  In any event
	many of the things that you intend to "bring" to us have been here for
	several years, some have been tried at parties with varied success
	other things will be tried in the future.  Be aware that we welcome
	your contribution but it doesn't seem to me that you bring anything
	special.

	The other thing that bothers me is your delivery.  I think a lot of
	the people (at least on this list) tend to believe in "leadership
	by example", I for one have had enough of following "the Great Man"
	in the I-Ching sense of the word; people here will listen to you
	and align (not follow) with your purpose based upon your actions and
	the results that you produce.  We are pretty much a non-hierachical
	bunch and tend to respond well to people who have proven mastery over
	their own destinies and can produce specific mesurable results,  If
	you throw a party and people clearly have the experiece of being,
	focused, uplifted of catalyzed, they will return, and bring friends
	and spread the meme so to speak, there have been some LEGENDARY parties
	here and there will be many in the future, we are open to having you
	be a part of that, but you can't run it and you can't control it, it has
	a life of it's own regardless of what hype or spin you put on it.
	All I seem to hear from your direction is "over here! Follw me!"  
	My question to you is, "Why?"

	Many of us are very dedicated to the "Scene", some of us go out every
	night, some are DJs, some are party promoters,  Many of us are busy
	building social, physical and virtual infrastructures so that some of
	the experiences that have touched us can last and impact the world at
	large, we do this quietly because we know that the swiftest most
	deadly meme is the one that The Empire doesn't hear coming.

	We are future.

	We are everywhere.


				G

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NEXUS SYSTEMS/CYBERTRIBE-5 : Voice:(415)965-2384 
Editor/Instigator/Catalyst : Geoff White <geoffw@nexsys.net>
Universal Movement Trinity : umt@nexsys.net

	              "RAVE: For a better tomorrow"

		--PGP Public key available upon request--
     "If I can't trance, I don't want to be part of your revolution"

point out at this point, the lack of direct quotation.  I did not state
that anybody was guilty.  I did state that the comment was PREJUDICIAL and
nothing else. Remember, what I was talking about was the use of the word
gangsta as it is commonly used.

It is statements like the one above that really get under my skin (no pun
inteneded).  This person is starting a very personal attack. Instead of
clearly attacking my ideas, he tries to attack me.  Whatever, this is just
more of the SAME OLD SHIT.  Attack the person, and not the idea.  How very
Amerikkkan.

>Now assume the Germans were guilty of genocide on the Jews. Well it might be
>karmic justice.. Turning to Deuteronomy Chapter 7 ( Preacher Clay assends to
>the pulpit - please laugh :-)  )...  Speaking of the seven nations of Canaan
>7:2 And when the lord thy god shall deliver them before thee; thou shalt

>that indicate to me that early jews were both capable and commanded by their
>god to practice genocide (attmpted genocide ) or whatever. So were they
>innocent lambs brought before the germans ?

Clearly a lack of understanding of history.  I will not attempt to educate
this person about genocide.  The fact is the Germans were guilty of
genocide against anyone who did not fit the classification of Aryan.
Please review your history.

This statement does not deserve more attention.

>
>Will we continue to blame people for the sins of their forefathers. Did
>blacks in africa never attempt genocide against other blacks?  Indians never
>against indians in americas ? Is anyone truly innocent ? Or for that matter
>guilty ?

Please re-read the post.  This is all starting to be a very familiar routine...

>What bothers me most is that JSL starts a thread complaining that whites
>use these "code words" for blacks and people of color and then he proceeds
>to PREJUDICIOUSLY condemn whites he doesn't know OR ask for what he in his
>prejudice "thinks" they are saying...  based mostly on the fact that it
>is a "white" that is talking...  Yes racial prejudice is alive and well but
>on BOTH sides. And yes, genocide has been attempted BY many peoples of all
>colors....

Geez...as the great orator Roanld Reagan once said "...here we go
again...". I complained my friend, that the use of the word gangsta is used
in this society against people of color.  I left it wide open as to it's
usage, and did not blame whites SOLELY for it's use.  You read into
something that was not there.  I left in the possibility that ANYONE could
use the word, it was not an exclusive perview of whites to use the word.
What I was syaing was that the use of the word, by anyone, was a direct
affront against people of color.  You assume that only whites have such
prejudices.  I made no assumption as to the user of the word.  Re-read the
post.

I made no compalaints about whites, I made a complaint about the use of a
word by a particlar individual.  He apologized for using it, I accepted and
the matter is now closed.  I based my virtiol on the FACT that the word is
prejudicial, and that it's use was given no thought, or reason.  I blamed
Crunch for it's use, and people in general for it's propagation and use.  I
blamed no particular group of people for it's use.  But you would not know
that since you did not read the post, and are engaging in a personal
attack.

You do not want to pick a fight with me, sir.

The problem I have with people like Mike is that they don't read posts.
The second problem I have with people like Mike is that they prefer to
continue a thread publicly that I now consider closed.  The problem I have
against people like Mike is that they spend alot of time not making direct
quatations to support their counter-point, and engage in much unsupported
conjecture.  The problem I have with people like Mike is that they lack a
historical perspective.  People like Mike start nasty flame-wars.  One of
which I am ending.

I think it is appropriate at this stage to mention the South African Rave
Evolution. - which is a story with lots of twists and turns, ( an event
timeline story is archived at hyperreal) about how it is possible for an
entire nation of people to change their perception and evolve from
Apartheid to an inclusive, democratic, non-racial society that not only
protects peoples rights against discrimination on the basis of race, class
or creed but also sexual ORIENTATION (ie even the transgendered)

If Sfravers would like me to do a couple of postings on this interesting
subject, then let me know - would'nt want to take up bandwidth with
relevence.

- david dei

PS: It is not good enough to be merely anti-racist (against racism) one has
to incorporate a non-racial (not defined by race) perspective where race is
no longer a factor.

>celebrating together whatever our color, size, sexual oriention or past
>nationality. Let's simply be who we are together and not blame each other for
>the sins of the past that ALL peoples carry not just whites....
>
>More than enough said I'm sure....
>
>Mike

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sat Mar 18 13:13:28 1995
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) id NAA15913; Sat, 18 Mar 1995 13:13:28 -0800
Received: from SIRIUS.COM by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) with SMTP id NAA15907; Sat, 18 Mar 1995 13:13:25 -0800
Received: from slip213.sirius.com by SIRIUS.COM (NX5.67e/NX3.16M)
	id AA21234; Sat, 18 Mar 95 13:12:51 -0800
Message-Id: <9503182112.AA21234@SIRIUS.COM>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Date: Sat, 18 Mar 1995 13:16:06 -0600
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com (Chris Beaumont)
From: gabe@SIRIUS.COM (Gabe)
Subject: Yes we can get along
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

>In reading all these posts about perceived differences between different
>cliques in the scene.. I'm reminded of Rodney King's statement after the LA
>riots..
>"Can't We All Get Along"  .. I know a lot of you.. and I can see that there are
>a lot of misunderstandings floating around that really have no basis in
>real differences.. just misconceptions.. We're all in it together..
>-Chris.

Yes we can get along! Because we are a group of very wonderful people who
are experiencing something unique. We are a part of a community that is
struggling to understand and experience ideas as complex and loaded as
racism and genocide. I think one thing that is obvious is that we are
talking about these things. A lot of people don't have an oppurtunity to be
a part of a community that is trying to grapple with these issues.  It is a
very wonderful, pure experience that is happening. And we can, and are,
learning from these communications. I think that raves are inherently
non-racist in the nature of the experience. The love I feel their seems so
pure that it cannot be based on race or gender, its pure, but we aren't in
that all the time. We have to our jobs, and our school, and our day to day
lives.  Yet, I think that what is going on is an attempt to come to a
higher understanding about these things. I know I have a learned a lot from
this thread, I learned about the Creek tribe and their treatment by the US
government, I learned about the way people perceive genocide,  I learned
about what it is like to have people perceive you as a criminal because of
the color of your skin, I learned about how all of this can overwhelm
people and cause them to think we are saying that all white people are
evil.
        Racism is truly something that is difficult to understand because
so much of our thoughts are internalized without discussion and further
thinking.  So naturally some people get tense, and reactionary when such
tender topics are touched upon. It is all part of coming to a better
understanding about the world we live in, and our history, and ourselves.
We should try to get through to an understanding about the way we exist
today and how we got here.  And every step forward we take is truly
wonderful and miraculous experience. Much that we experience is geared
towards keeping us in our reactions and our misunderstandings. You see it
on the newspaper, and our tv, and in our political system.  All of this
manages to keep people from coming to real understandings about what other
people think. A better understanding of the issues facing our world and
ourselves will not come from "Nightline", it will come from our community
of wonderful loving people talking with each other, sharing our
experiences, feelings, and knowledge about how we percieve the world. It is
difficult but it can only bring us closer to a truer understanding of the
people that we love so much at raves, and beyond.  So we must be honest, we
must say how we feel and object when we are hurt by something someone has
said. It will work out as long as we try to understand more than react.  We
can move further towards letting the wonder and strength of the love that
we feel at a rave into our very being and thought. Good luck!

With hope and love,
Gabe

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sun Mar 19 04:16:34 1995

My heart goes out to all those involved at f&f, especially Ethan.  The 
party was romping, a little crowded, but such a nice vibe.  There were so 
many smiles and warm looks everywhere I looked.
Not long after I went near the door to get some air, I noticed a few 
police officers.  Some words were exchanged, and the next thing I saw was 
4 cops grabbing, handcuffing and hauling away a raver.  Shortly after 
that the party was shut down.
I want to thank those involved at the party, and Ethan especially who I 
heard taking full responsibility, and getting cited.  Ethan please let me 
know the amount of the citation, so I can help out.


peter 

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sun Mar 19 08:52:37 1995
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) id IAA02800; Sun, 19 Mar 1995 08:52:37 -0800
Received: from netcom7.netcom.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) with ESMTP id IAA02792; Sun, 19 Mar 1995 08:52:33 -0800
Received: by netcom7.netcom.com (8.6.10/Netcom)
	id IAA09291; Sun, 19 Mar 1995 08:51:20 -0800
From: larryc@netcom.com (Larry Ching)
Message-Id: <199503191651.IAA09291@netcom7.netcom.com>
Subject: F&F/All Together Now
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Date: Sun, 19 Mar 1995 08:51:19 -0800 (PST)
X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.4 PL23]
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Length: 4504      
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Two part report:

 Friends & Family Sardines
 The telephone info line was so busy that I didn't get through until
9:30PM. I used some of the time before that to buy some bananas and 
peppermints for the party. Arrived at the map point to be greeted by the
sight of a huge line ( for a map point ), about 35 bodies long, and people
arriving every minute. Bought my ticket and map w/DJ lineup from Susan
and Ethan. Drove to the site and parked within a city block of it.

 I got there soon enough to beat the monster lineup that was to be my
major bum memory of this event. Inside , it was very nice! Upstairs and
downstairs dance areas and an interesting chill area in the rear of the
upper story. The crowd and the DJs were both in top form!

 It started getting pretty crowded , and some of the flaws of the
space began to show themselves. Some of the sofa-mattresses put out on the
floor for the comfort of the guests were placed along the path between 
the top of the stairs and the chill room , which narrowed the walkway
and thereby increased congestion. 

 Only one set of stairs between the upper and lower stories , and a normal
4-foot wide stairwell at that. The foot of these stairs were located at 
the only doorway to the site , meaning that the folks coming downstairs
and going upstairs were bumping into the stream trying to get in and out
the door.

 Last , but not least - from the phone message , 650 tickets were going
to be sold . Either more than this were sold , a lot of folks got in for 
free , or the holding capacity of the place was seriously overestimated.
By about 11:45 , the doorway admissions had to be limited to one in only
after one out. If you had wandered out to get some fresh air before this 
policy went into effect ( like me ) , you got an unpleasant surprise 
when you tried to get back in. Adding to this the disinterest in establishing
queues by the folks waiting outside, and you get a very bothersome 
atmosphere outside. I even snarled at one guy who tried to push past me,
and then grabbed his belt and pulled him back behind me! ( Only immediatley
afterwards noticing that he outsized me by an uneasy margin ...). 

 Just as I got back in , the promoters got the garage door open , which
they used to handle the in/out crowd , while reserving the doorway
for the newcomers with tickets. 

 I decided that the population density was too high for me - I went straight
for my bag and left , with the intentions of sleeping in my truck for
awhile , with the hopes of a later crowd reduction. I woke up at about 3AM,
and asked some folks walking by the truck how the party was going. They
told me the bad news that the police had shut it down. A drive-by verified
the presence of at least 5 patrol cars on the main street near the site .

 SUMMARY: Great fun while I was inside! Bummer when I stepped outside. Got
  to see a lot of nice SFRavers , some who I had never met in person before!
  
 So , I went to All Together Now ...

 It was held in what seemed to be a small SOMA industrial site that was in the 
middle of remodelling - open , bare walls and unpainted wallboard. At least 
that's  what it appeared to be with the lack of lighting - really dark. The
front  room was devoted to house and techno , while the back room had jungle 
(!).  Very dancable jungle too - it was the first time in my limited exposure
to jungle that I heard something I could dance to. And it's a lot of fun
too! I guess they were spinning very Jamaican dub-by jungle - I must look
for this stuff on CD or vinyl ( any DJ got a good tape out locally yet? ). 

 Steamy atmosphere , lots of empty rooms for chill space. Mellow crowd. Ailing
sound systems ( the jungle room had to shut down because of sound system
failure , and the front room had a mono stack setup and one stack with no
sound coming out of it ).

 In order to relieve the steamy atmosphere , somebody had opened the back 
garage door. Through it , I could seem some driving into a garage in the 
building across the street. It looked like semi-residential property in
back , which meant sleeping people ( and the guy who had just come home ).
I had a promonition ...

 Sure enough , the police showed up a half-hour later. I decided to leave 
for home - it was about 4:40AM anyway , so I had a full night. Went to
Sparky's for breakfast , and down to Sunnyvale to my computer terminal!

 Summary of "All Together Now" - Educational! Steamy! Dark. Lousy sound.

 --------  Larry Ching / larryc@netcom.com ----

What a party ! And once again far too crowded - only this time we TRIED to
prevent it. It's clear that we would have filled the Berkeley space that
fell through. 

The little that I wandered around I heard great stuff from deaks, a bit of
some tasty ambient from wbl. Amazing ambient room layout - we have to give
you people more room to work your magic - I've seen none better except for
lack of space. The alter was great!!! Was this a lot of New Moon's input ?

Downstairs the "techno room" took off. Bryce was OBVIOUSLY having a great
time during his set --- Lee built the energy from there -- Alex and Ethan
what can I say ? All were just phucking phantastigorical ! The walls were
just running with water. I was standing in a small pool trying to make its
way to my barrier strips. Thank you Lee for finding me some rags to fight
the flow :-)

People were smiling, dancing, talking, hugging, giving away candy, shouting,
whistling.. I noticed the floor upstairs was bouncing like a trampoline 
under the estatic pulsing of dancers.

This was very definitely the best F&F yet except of course for its far to
sudden and rude ending. I was thinking how dead a typical bar scene is 
compared to the pulsing joy of revelling ravers I felt last night. People
need many more celebrations like this to keep their sanity and balance in
an often insane and unbalanced world ! 

And finally, I want to really send a special thank you to Ethan and Bryce
the founding fathers of F&F.. Your work and vision do you justice and I for
one appreciate it greatly. It's pure pleasure doing visuals for your-our
events!! Now I know what I've worked on visuals these past few years for.
I'm far richer for my association with this group than money would ever make
me.....

Thanks all
Ameba, Cloud Factory, New Moon, Pacific and of course all our Friends & 
Family

You really make it happen !

Mike


 meclay@netcom.com          |  Alone & estatic 
 Mike Clay   (415)572-8971  |  A young rainbow learns  to levitate.

From: ken.stuart@tigerteam.org (Ken Stuart)
Subject: Rave Drama on Channel 9
Date: Sun, 19 Mar 1995 03:24:00 GMT
Message-Id: <95031914151412583@tigerteam.org>
Organization: Tiger Team Buddhist Info Net:  Modem (510) 268-0102
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hello,

This Thursday night (March 23) from 9:00 pm until 11:00 pm, Channel 9 
(KQED) is airing a episode of "Mystery", a British whodunnit series.

The episode, entitled "Cherubim and Seraphim" is about a British police
detective whose niece takes a new drug called "Seraphim" at a "party"
(a rave or house party, although neither term is ever used) which
causes her to have an experience so profound that she commits suicide
afterwards.  Most of the two hours is about the investigator trying to
discover what the scene is about and why she committed suicide.

In my experience, this program is unique in that depicts fairly
accurately, BOTH the parental and un-hip adult point of view AND the
raver point of view -- although the latter is rarely given first hand
by the ravers themselves - instead they are voiced as discoveries by
the investigator ("I was so miserable at age 15 that it didn't occur to
me that they might be doing this [party] because they were happy").  In
that sense, it is different from the usual wholesale condemnation of
partying that is usually found in such programs.  In fact, during the
first hour or so, it looks like it is going in that usual direction...

The depictions of the raves seem pretty accurate too (for one thing,
they have map points, etc.) [although I've never been to one in the
UK].

Recommended if you are interested in either media depictions of raves,
or are interested in the mental processes of people who are opposed to
such things.  Entertaining, but not particularly uplifting. :-)

respect to all,

Ken
ken.stuart@tigerteam.org

___ Blue Wave/QWK v2.12

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sun Mar 19 19:00:28 1995
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) id TAA05790; Sun, 19 Mar 1995 19:00:28 -0800
Received: from sysx.apana.org.au by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.10/8.6.5) with ESMTP id SAA05619; Sun, 19 Mar 1995 18:59:36 -0800
